table.caption: Active Administered Medications - up to 3 most recent administrations

td.paragraph: Intravenous, PRN Conditional, Starting on Tue 9/20/22 at 0907, Until Discontinued, other (enter comment), For Anaphylactic Reaction that includes CUTANEOUS SYMPTOMS (e.g. localized itching, flushing, hives, swelling) from Pegaspargase
EPINEPHrine PF (ADRENALIN) 1 mg/mL (1 mL) injection 0.11 mg

Intramuscular, PRN Conditional, Starting on Tue 9/20/22 at 0907, Until Discontinued, other (enter comment), For Anaphylactic Reaction that includes RESPIRATORY SYMPTOMS (e.g. swallowing/breathing difficulty, throat tightening/closing, hoarseness) and/or CARDIOVASCULAR SYMPTOMS (e.g. hypotension/decreased blood perfusion) from Pegaspargase If both respiratory/cardiovascular systems and cutaneous symptoms of anaphylaxis present, give EPINEPHrine first, followed by BENADRYL. Repeat doses of EPINEPHrine can be given every 5-15 minutes as needed for unresolved symptoms. Please contact MD for additional EPINEPHrine orders.

Intravenous, PRN Conditional, Starting on Tue 9/20/22 at 0907, Until Discontinued, other (enter comment), For Anaphylactic Reaction that includes CUTANEOUS SYMPTOMS (e.g. localized itching, flushing, hives, swelling) that are UNRESOLVED following dose of BENADRYL for Pegaspargase
famotidine (PEPCID) 40 mg/5 mL oral liquid 5.52 mg
Oral, 2 Times a Day, First dose on Tue 9/20/22 at 0915, Until Discontinued
Oral, 2 Times a Day, First dose on Tue 9/20/22 at 0915, Until Discontinued

Intravenous, PRN Conditional, Starting on Tue 9/20/22 at 0907, Until Discontinued, other (enter comment), For Anaphylactic Reaction that includes RESPIRATORY SYMPTOMS (e.g. swallowing/breathing difficulty, throat tightening/closing, hoarseness) that are UNRESOLVED following doses of EPINEPHrine, from Pegaspargase
Intravenous, Every 6 Hours PRN, Starting on Thu 9/22/22 at 1510, Until Discontinued, nausea/vomiting
Intravenous, Every 8 Hours PRN, Starting on Thu 9/22/22 at 0000, Until Discontinued, nausea/vomiting, To give Q8H PRN when ondansetron (zofran) Q8H order is completed. Give IV or oral ondansetron.

td.paragraph: DAUNOrubicin (CERUBIDINE) 12 mg in D5W 250 mL infusion

Intravenous, Once, 1 dose, On Tue 9/20/22 at 0915, Give on day 1. VESICANT; Protect from light. HAZARDOUS DRUG: Antineoplastic- Handle and dispose of properly. See Hyperlinks in MAR for PPE. , 25 mg/m2/dose

Oral, 2 Times a Day With Meals, 28 doses, First dose on Tue 9/20/22 at 0915, Last dose on Mon 10/3/22 at 1800, To be given with meals on day 1-14 (do not taper). (May give IV in the equivalent dose), 5 mg/m2/dose (round upward to the nearest 0.25 mg)
ondansetron (ZOFRAN) 1.66 mg in NS 6.6 mL injection

Intravenous, Every 8 Hours, 6 doses, First dose on Tue 9/20/22 at 0915, Last dose on Thu 9/22/22 at 0115, For nausea/vomiting. Give first dose prior to starting chemotherapy. Give IV or oral ondansetron.
